projectDetails.label: Title
projectDetails.value: Promoting AI Using Inter-disciplinary Learning Communities in STEM Education

executiveSummary: The evolution of technology has profoundly shaped modern education, particularly in Science, a unique strength and ability to adopt and then incorporate emerging technologies in the teaching and learning process. This project leverage the unique ability of community colleges to form Inter-disciplinary Learning Communities (ILCs). ILCs are collaborative educational environments where students and faculty from different academic disciplines come together to explore common themes, issues, and emerging technologies from multiple and different perspectives.

team.introduction: The AI ILC initiative draws upon deep expertise in cybersecurity education, workforce development, and industry partnerships. Each team member contributes specialized knowledge essential to achieving the project's ambitious goals.

leadership.name: Dr. John Sands
leadership.title: Principal Investigator
leadership.bio: Dr. Sands brings over 35 years of national cybersecurity education and career pathway experience to the project. As leader of the NCAE Educational Pathways National Center and former director of the Center for System Security and Information Assurance (CSSIA), he has extensive experience identifying and addressing emerging technologies educational needs.

leadership.name: Jiri Jirik
leadership.title: Co-Principal Investigator (Project Manager)
leadership.bio: Jiri serves as project manager, leveraging his vast experience in developing and delivering training focused on industry credentials including CISA, CISM, and CISSP. Jiri is responsible for designing, implementing, and assessing professional development programs for faculty to effectively integrate AI into their teaching.

leadership.name: Stanley Kostka
leadership.title: Senior Personnel
leadership.bio: Stan brings valuable experience from managing the Midwest NCAE Hub, which encompassed over 110 institutions. He is serving as the project’s Learning Community Team Leader managing the project’s communication strategies, organizing events, and disseminating information about the project’s activities and outcomes.

leadership.name: Michael Gonzalez
leadership.title: Graphic Artist/Publications/Social Media Coordinator
leadership.bio: Michael serves as the Communication and Events Coordinator managing the project’s communication strategies, organizing events, and disseminating information about the project’s activities and outcomes. In this role Mike is responsible for developing and implementing a comprehensive communication plan, manage the project’s website, social media, and other communication channels.

mainGoals.goal: 1. Establish a Collaborative Framework for Inter-Disciplinary AI Learning Communities
objectives: Objective 1.1: Form inter-disciplinary teams comprised of educators from Information Technology, Computer Science, Math, Manufacturing, Health Sciences, Business, Automotive Technologies, and other STEM programs within the first six months of the project.

Objective 1.2: Develop and document a standardized framework for inter-disciplinary collaboration, including meeting schedules, communication strategies, and decision-making processes, by the end of the first year.

Objective 1.3: Conduct quarterly evaluations of the inter-disciplinary teams' effectiveness, including feedback from participants, and refine the collaborative framework based on evaluations throughout the project duration.

mainGoals.goal: 2. Integrate AI into Existing STEM Curricula
objectives: Objective 2.1: Identify at least six existing STEM courses that can incorporate AI tools and concepts and develop a plan for curriculum integration within the second year.

Objective 2.2: Create and pilot at least twelve new instructional modules or content pieces designed to embed AI knowledge, skills, and abilities into the identified courses by the end of the second year.
Objective 2.3: Measure the impact of AI integration on student learning outcomes through pre- and post- implementation assessments,

mainGoals.goal: 3. Develop and Deliver Faculty Development Workshops on AI in Education
objectives: Objective 3.1: Design and deliver a series of at least four faculty development workshops per academic year on AI tools, applications, and teaching strategies.
Objective 3.2: Achieve a participation rate of 50% of faculty members in the workshops in the relevant disciplines within the first two years of the project.

Objective 3.3: Assess the workshops' effectiveness through participant surveys and follow-up interviews, with a goal of 90% of participants reporting increased confidence in integrating AI into their teaching practices.

mainGoals.goal: 4. Disseminate Best Practices and Expand the Initiative Nationally
objectives: Objective 4.1: Create a comprehensive set of resources, including case studies, instructional materials, and policy recommendations, to be shared with other community colleges by the end of the third year.
Objective 4.2: Present the project's findings and best practices at a minimum of three national conferences or workshops within the final year of the project.

Objective 4.3: Establish partnerships with at least 2 additional community colleges to adopt the framework and best practices developed with a goal of initiating expansion efforts before the project’s conclusion.

accomplishments: Successfully established 8 inter-disciplinary learning communities across 5 partner institutions.
Launched the 'AI in STEM' faculty portal, a repository for all developed instructional modules, which has received over 2,000 unique visits.
Presented initial findings at the 'Innovations in EdTech' national conference, receiving the 'Best Practice' award.

broaderImpact: This project contributes to the national need for an AI-literate workforce by upskilling faculty at the community college level.
The developed collaborative framework serves as a model for other institutions seeking to break down departmental silos.
Findings are actively being disseminated to a national audience to promote broader adoption.

quotes.quote: The AI workshops completely changed how I approach my curriculum. I now feel equipped to prepare my students for the modern workforce.
quotes.author: Dr. Jane Smith
quotes.title: Professor, Information Technology

quotes.quote: Being part of the inter-disciplinary learning community has been invaluable. I've learned so much from my colleagues in other departments.
quotes.author: Prof. Michael Chen
quotes.title: Faculty, Manufacturing

quotes.quote: As a student in a course using the new AI modules, I feel like I'm learning relevant, cutting-edge skills that will directly apply to my future career.
quotes.author: Emily White
quotes.title: Student, Computer Science
